title: 104_hr2333
content: The Act titled "Distilled Spirits Tax Payment Simplification Act of 1995" is introduced, amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Section 5212 is modified regarding the transfer of distilled spirits between bonded premises. The Act "Distilled Spirits Tax Payment Simplification Act of 1995" amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, specifically modifying Section 5212 to allow for the transfer of distilled spirits between bonded premises without payment of internal revenue tax. Additionally, Section 5232 is amended to allow for the withdrawal of imported distilled spirits to bonded premises without tax payment. SEC. 3 amends Section 5171 to include bonded dealers in the establishment of distilled spirits plants. SEC. 4 addresses the operation of distilled spirits plants. SEC. 4 amends Section 5178(a) to allow bonded dealers to store distilled spirits and other beverages on the premises of a distilled spirits plant. SEC. 5 introduces definitions for "bonded dealer" and "control State entity" and allows for the election to be treated as a bonded dealer under section 5011. Any wholesale dealer or control State entity may elect to be treated as a bonded dealer if they sell bottled distilled spirits exclusively to specific entities. Special rules apply to prevent conflicts of interest between bonded dealers and independent retail dealers. Ownership interests and control relationships are limited to 10 percent. The text discusses the conditions for a wholesale dealer or control State entity to elect to be treated as a bonded dealer, with rules regarding ownership interests and control relationships. It also mentions that once the election is made, bottled distilled spirits in inventory are not subject to additional Federal excise tax. The election can be revoked at any time with the consent of the Secretary. The Secretary must approve applications from individuals electing to be treated as bonded dealers, ensuring equitable treatment for those using the LIFO inventory method to prevent recapture of their LIFO reserve. The application for a basic permit under section 204(a)(2) of title 27 of the United States Code shall be accorded notice and hearing as described in section 204(b) of such title 27. Conforming amendment to tables of sections of subpart A of part I of subchapter A of chapter 51 and the table of contents of subtitle E. SEC. 6 amends Section 5006 to determine tax on distilled spirits when transferred to a bonded dealer. SEC. 7 amends section 5008 regarding loss or destruction of distilled spirits, including changes to subsections (a)(1)(A), (a)(2), (c)(1), and (c)(2). SEC. 8. TIME FOR COLLECTING TAX ON DISTILLED SPIRITS. In section 5061(d), paragraph (5) is redesignated as paragraph (6) and a new paragraph is added regarding advanced payment of distilled spirits tax for bonded dealers with an election in effect. Payment that would be due in October or November must be made on September 20 without penalty or interest. Section 5061(e) is amended to include bonded dealers in the advanced payment of distilled spirits tax, with a payment deadline of September 20 to avoid penalties or interest. SEC. 9. EXEMPTION FROM OCCUPATIONAL TAX NOT APPLICABLE. This exemption shall not apply to a proprietor of a distilled spirits plant whose premises are used for operations of a bonded dealer. SEC. 10. TECHNICAL, CONFORMING AND CLERICAL AMENDMENTS. Technical and Conforming Amendments include changes to various sections related to distilled spirits operations, such as removing certain terms, redesignating subsections, and clarifying exceptions for bonded dealers. Amendments are made to sections related to distilled spirits operations, including inserting "bonded dealer" in various places and repealing sections 5115, 5180, and 5681. Clerical amendments involve updating table of sections to reflect these changes. The table of sections for part IV of subchapter J of chapter 51 is amended by striking out the item relating to section 5681. SEC. 11. EFFECTIVE DATE. The provisions of this Act shall take effect 120 days following enactment, with specific amendments taking effect immediately for wholesale dealers required to file registration applications under the Federal Alcohol Administration Act. Bonded premises operation qualification is granted until the Secretary's final action on the application. Qualified bonded premises can operate until the Secretary makes a final decision on the registration application.
